Header: Army-Trained Set of PHIs Receive Certificates & Begin Duties
Content: Sri Lanka Army Medical Corps (SLAMC) - trained twenty five Army Public Health Inspectors (PHIs) batch passed out on Wednesday (10) at the Colombo Army Hospital auditorium in Narahenpita. The SLAMC in close consultation with the Commander of the Army began this training since the scarcity of PHIs across the country affects inspection routines inside island-wide Army establishments which would pose a health hazard in the long run. Major General Sanjeewa Munasinghe, Director General Army Health Services & Colonel Commandant, SLAMC as the Chief Guest attended the ceremony and awarded certificates.
